hint.text:
Arithmetic mean (A) is a number between two numbers a and b such that the sequence formed a,A,b will be in A.P.
i.e. common difference (d)=A-a=b-A

solution.text:
As mentioned in Hint
Inserting A.M.(A) between two numbers a and b will make the newly formed sequence \(a,A,b\) in A.P.
therefore
the common difference of the A.P. will be
\(d=A-a=b-A\)
\(A-a=b-A\)
\(2A=b+a\)
\(A=\frac{a+b}{2}\)
\(A=_{{(p+q)/2}}_\)

content.text: Find the arithmetic mean (A.M.) of the numbers _{p}_ and _{q}_?
